website_summaries.verdict: This model boasts good quality sound for built-in monitor speakers, and the curved widescreen format provides an immersive gaming experience.
pros: Refresh rate can be set at 120 hertz with minimal blur
Curved screen format offers the best viewing angles on the market and true widescreen technology
Viewing angles are increased even further by the 35-inch screen
The 9 watt speakers offer surprisingly good sound compared to many built-in monitor speakers
cons: Some users have reported flickering when the monitor is set to the highest refresh rates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 32 inch 165 hz Predator Gaming Mon
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor, 32 inch 1440P and 165hz refresh rate. The colors are bright and vivid and have great contrast, with bright whites and inky blacks. User interface far better then older Predators with a joy stick to toggle through the settings. The stand is solid and heavy. The 16X9 ratio means no black bars like those on ultra wides. This one is the real deal.Most if not all the past issues with large screen, fast refresh rate screens are gone. This one is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: S. Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control dead pixels on 2 monitors
customer_reviews.text: This monitor would've been a 4 star but due to me receiving two bad monitors I've given it 1 star for poor quality control. There is slight back light bleed so if that bothers you be aware before purchasing this monitor. Great resolution and excellent refresh rates with over clocking 120hz. G sync makes such a big different and good viewing angles. Heavy duty base with good adjustment on the stand. Wish I would've got a good one but returning these have already frustrated me enough.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Pai

customer_reviews.title: Overall, fantastic. Downside ghosting.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from Asus 144hz 1080p 27" What I like: Build quality is great I love how fast this monitor turns on/off, such a seemingly trivial thing that becomes really nice to have over time Picture quality is great I'm not super picky about color range though I did notice this is definitely more vibrant than any other display I've owned. What I don't like: Bezels here are massive. The OSD is better than most but the buttons placement on the bottom is not ideal. Ghosting in some games is really bad, while others I don't notice any. Oddly enough the worst offender so far is Diablo 3 which has absolutely terrible ghosting. Would I buy it again: Definitely.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Mysterious damage!
customer_reviews.text: I did love this monitor, but then after about 9 weeks the screen developed damage that isn't covered by the warranty. They claim it had to be done here, but I have no idea how. It was working in the morning, but when I turned it on after lunch, there was a vertical tear. It's just me, my wife, and two cats. I know I didn't do anything. She has her own desk and PC. And the cats don't go near the monitor. Needless to say, I'm at a loss, and presently out $900. It's a $500 repair. I can't see sinking another $500 into this monitor. I'll but a replacement, and one of those Amazon extended warranty things.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: One dead pixel, but it's off to the side so I kept it; the one I bought before this from Newegg had more than 1 dead pixel. Top quality stand, and screen; overclocks fine to 165hz. Only issue with the monitor is that they put more $$$ into the lights then they did on the speakers; which, monitors aren't known for their built in speakers, but they're bad enough to where they could've just not put them in at all and made it thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A.

customer_reviews.title: Overall, really happy
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the best 34" ultrawide you can buy right now but so far I'm really happy with this purchase. Backlight bleed does exist when the screen is blank but I don't see it with any content on the screen in daily use. Color adjustment took a bit of googling to get the screen colors looking balanced along with a brightness and contrast level that meets my preferences. I need color accuracy over refresh rate so I am running at 100hz rather than 120hz and it still feels great. Big improvement over and old 75hz screen.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Flickering is horrible, already sending it back after having it for a day
customer_reviews.text: This monitor arrived at my house yesterday, worked great with absolutely no issues. Today I go to load up a game and the screen starts turning off and on continuously every few seconds. I've researched and apparently this is a huge issue with this thing. You can turn off G-Sync and get a crappy 60 fps and it doesn't flicker but why pay all this money for an advertised 120hz refresh rate when it doesn't even work. I had high hopes for this monitor but I will no longer be buying Acer products, every time I have there's been an issue. NOT worth the money or the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hutchins

customer_reviews.title: Incredible monitor
customer_reviews.text: Just wow. You'll need to configure picture settings but after that just wow! My first gaming monitor ever! Going from a 4k tv to this makes a huge difference. Colors are phenomenal picture has zero ghosting and 165 fps just scrolling through the web is huge lol. Buy it and love it. Also minimum back light bleed with mine. Only thing i hate is the built in speaker audio quality dont recommended using them at all. Buy a good set of pc speakers or use some headphones!
customer_reviews.author: susan hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto!
customer_reviews.text: I compared many monitors before buying this. For the price tag, nothing beats this monitor. I was reading reviews about every monitor just like you, and was scared about all the rumors and bad reviews. However Acer always delivers high quality products with decent prices. I was looking for 100+ Hz, 3440x1440p display with Gsync, I skipped HP Omen 35, AOG, and ASUS.products after careful evaluation. No doubt that there are better monitors than Z35P, but at this price, this one is perfect. It also overclocks to 120Hz. It is a no brainer
customer_reviews.author: Shamil Farajullayev

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Been a long time Acer fan unfortunately the quality control here is just bad. Saw many reviews about a flickering over time and after two weeks of no problem, and great experience, I too began to have those problems. Called Amazon who were great, spoke with Acer eventually was said a hardware problem. Definitely a quality control issue with this entire model I suspect based on the Dell issues with the same based ips panel the manufacturer is to blame. I would highly recommend staying away from this one. Sent back for the new MSI 144mhz, manufacturer is Samsung on the panel itself so hoping better qa.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Ghosting, Ghosting and more Ghosting
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after tons of messing with menus, color profiles and Nvidia Control Panel settings, this thing ghosts like nobody's business. I play a lot of racing sims and it is highly distracting when the lines on the side of a track develop weird ghosting while turning. Also shows up in FPS games when panning quickly which is equally as distracting. The 120Hz overclock is buttery smooth and beautiful to look at but unfortunately, the ghosting takes this to a one star for me. Go with the Asus ROG Swift for 20 bucks more. Sure it only has 100Hz max, but it is a better quality monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: If mine broke I would buy the same one again.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice monitor; haven't had any issues with it. Picture quality is really great at 1440p and 144hz was a must have. The curved feature really didn't matter. I have used 32" monitors that were flat and there was virtually no difference for me at about 3 feet viewing distance. Note that a bit less than 3 feet viewing distance, it was a bit large to play FPS games on. RPG games however, really good.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST MONITOR PERIOD! DON'T HESITATE, GET ONE!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a good g-sync 2k monitor with high refresh rate, and this one impressed me on more than just one level. Playing Wow in 2k with 165Hz refresh rate is a total dope now. Picture quality phenomenal, performance not out of this world, contrast and color unmatched to any monitor I've used before. Undoubtedly one of the best monitors right now on the market. It looks pretty damn stunning too with highly premium build and quality. I am getting second one for my wife. It is that freaking good.
customer_reviews.author: Kyusho Jitsu Master

customer_reviews.title: Great product from a great Manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this monitor as my main for about 4 months now. Nothing has even come close to this kind of quality that I have owned in the past 10 years. The picture is excellent, I have it overclocked to 165Hz with my 1080ti and I have yet to play a game at less than 100FPS maxed out settings across the board. No screen tearing, no issues with ghosting, no dead pixels, and no discoloration. BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Travis James Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Love this monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Dell 2716DG with the Acer Predator Gaming Z321QU. Going from 27" to a 32" is an amazing gaming experience. I just love this monitor. You have to use the Display Port to use the G-Sync and this monitor performs. it just pulls you in the game so much better than the 27" monitor does. The slight curve of the screen fills some of your peripheral vision. Colors and brightness are good. I did not have to calibrate the settings very much. Very satisfied. Never going back to a 27' monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Fred B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for gaming and dev work
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think I needed anything bigger than a 27” as I only game or dev and I never had a curved monitor before but this monitor has definitely exceeded all my expectations. I can’t recommend this monitor enough to my friends and still get amazed by the way some games look on it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Walker

customer_reviews.title: Premium gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: I love the size with the curve, it is a huge improvement over side by side flat screens. Also, great for widescreen movies. I don’t really get why they include speakers, it just ads to the price for something I didn’t really want on it. If someone is going to use a high quality monitor like this then they are most likely using high end speakers or headphones as well, which makes them useless. Mood backlighting is fine, but not necessary. I liked the included stand, and the way it came out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: comfortare

customer_reviews.title: Screen not take smash good!
customer_reviews.text: Power connection socket pin broke, something that should never happen WOULD NEVER HAPPEN IF THEY USED NORMAL F****** POWER CORDS!!!, was gonna cost $150 just to send to them, so they could "repair it" which may not have been covered under my limited warranty, so I broke the leg off the stand and repeatly smashed the screen with said leg. Did not hold up well to that type of abuse. So my main problem would be that its not very durable. Hope my review helps.
customer_reviews.author: David Matthew Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely LOVES this monitor. We bought a different one previously and kept having problems with the pixels. He ended up having to exchange the other one twice then he decided to go with this one and he is completely happy with it. He uses it for a lot of gaming and the picture is awesome
customer_reviews.author: W.Clark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a triple screen setup consisting of 27'' 1080p60 bezelless monitors with this, and was a great move. Excellent image, overclocks to 120hz effortlessly, and never, EVER bobbles. My experience with Asus ROG revealed some very poor design choices, interior components, and unending problems. My brother has an Acer Predator which prompted me to buy one. I can see clearly why ROG has been bumped from the top slot!
customer_reviews.author: Harvey W. Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Acer Predator Z35P bmiphz 35" Curved 1800R QHD (3440x1440) G-SYNC  - Random black outs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this screen for gaming because of the over-clock to 120Hz capability. New update: 120Hz started blacking out again after the last fix. So this is still an issue... Works perfect at 100Hz, but randomly fails at 120Hz. Acer needs to fix this or stop advertising this overclocking that fails.... Old notes: Update: Great Monitor for gaming, etc... I had a minor issue and contacted Acer Support. The tech walked me through changing a setting on the monitor to turn "overdrive = off" and "overclock = on"
customer_reviews.author: Barry of Orange

customer_reviews.title: Started flickering after a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I was really enjoying this monitor until one day it started flickering. If you lower the refresh rate below 120Hz, the flickering stopped. But I purpose bought this monitor specifically to run at 120Hz. Seeing as it's incapable of doing that, it serves no purpose. This is the 2nd monitor at this resolution and specs that exhibited this issue. I'm returning it for a replacement in hopes the 3rd try is better.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Risto

customer_reviews.title: Best 120 hz 3440x1440 NVIDIA G-SYNC Monitor on the market, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best 120 hz 3440x1440 NVIDIA G-SYNC VA Monitor on the market, I even ordered ASUS ROG 32" 3440x1440 NVIDIA G-SYNC IPS Monitor and the colors were washed out and grey compared to this panel. I absolutely love it and only wished that i had purchased this a year ago!
customer_reviews.author: Nocturnal

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to step into the 2k (1440p) monitor world, and this monitor fit the bill. Easy setup and now utilizing the G-synch feature flawlessly. No complaints and I'm purely satisfied. The only thing that could have made this better was if it was "Free"! Don't hesitate to buy this monitor. Update: Since I bought this monitor I recommended it to my buddy and he bought one as well... 2 satisfied customers.
customer_reviews.author: Skooter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic display
customer_reviews.text: Awesome picture quality, no dead pixels, packaged really well with lots of padding. Worked fine with my VESA mount - has to google instructions though there wasn’t any in the box for mounting & wasn’t immediately obvious how it detached from the existing stand. I like the curve more than even expected, works fine for text while working during the day and adds just that little extra touch when gaming. Lights underneath are pretty subtle, would pop more on a lighter colored desk maybe
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Monitor For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: Packaged very well for shipping. Easy setup, great stand! HDMI and DP cables are "cheap", I'd pickup a higher end cable. You'll want to use a DP cable if you want to increase the refresh rate. Monitor menu is very straight forward. Key note, to get the monitor to go beyond 60 Hertz with Windows 10, you have to go into Advanced Display Settings and click Display Adapter Properties. Once there click the Monitor tab and change the Screen Refresh Rate to whatever you think looks best.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: BEST MONITOR EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ok, so, i got this monitor yesterday and this thing is FANTASTIC!! especially compared to my old asus 24in monitor this is the best monitor ive ever used and ive been through like 4. and it seems almost too good to be true, i mean, 500 bucks for a 32 inch, curved, 2k, frameless, flickerless, blueshield (eyecare as asus calls it), G-sync AND, up to 165 hertz!!!
customer_reviews.author: H. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The X34P is a great ultrawide. One of the best on the market at the moment. I would have given 5/5 overall but I had to send it in for repairs after 4 weeks because an issue with the original mainboard caused the audio on the speakers to go out. I sent it to Acer Repair center, they replaced the main board with a new one and I had it back within 3 weeks. Good service, no complaints. Works like new, just had to do without my computer for 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Just Wow
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is fantastic. No dead pixels! Arrived in wonderful condition. Easy set up. Gaming looks magnificent on this monitor. Only 1 comment. It takes a bit for the inputs to change. If you turn off an HDMI machine then try to switch to the DP input it takes a little time, but I am nit picking. Wonderful piece of hardware!!
customer_reviews.author: Mace C. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: badass monitor
customer_reviews.text: at first i was scared because i did not received the monitor and what happened was that a friend took it from my doorsteep because it was raining, a couple of days later he call me and told me he had it, i was getting crazy with amazon about it, well, after i got it i am very pleased with this monitor.. Gsync is mindblowing compare with no gsync monitors
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply an amazing display. I was missing out for so long
customer_reviews.text: Simply an amazing display. I was missing out for so long...always had decent hardware for gaming....good CPU (I7), decent video cards (always Nvidia), but always went cheap on monitors.....this is like night and day....first time in my gaming life, no tears in video.....none whatsoever.......Perfect for Battlefield 1, Battlefront 2, Wolfenstein 2, Titanfall 2....no issues....love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L Collier

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Moniter
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my existing acer moniter as a gaming upgrade, and could not be happier, the price is steep, but worth every penny. viewing angle is amazing, the curve is so nice and comfortable to look at, before I bought it I didn't realize how much it helps. also the built in speaker is nice icing on the cake. its not good for music. like bad for music actually but its fine for watching videos and you're buying a gaming monitor, so you probably have a headset anyway. TLDR its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: VESA mounting CRACKS screen
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in imperfect condition with several scratches on the stand. After two months I decided to put this on a VESA mount Upon hanging the monitor onto the mount, the screen cracked. Very disappointed on how fragile this product is. Doesn't seem to allow me to attach images to this review either. Curious.
customer_reviews.author: Brodicus89

customer_reviews.title: Guess i got dealt a very very bad hand from ACER
customer_reviews.text: only 4 stars because it was clearly stated that 120hz Overclock is not a guarantee...or even past 100hz at all......Guess i got dealt a very very bad hand from ACER....there is no option available for 120hz.....shame
customer_reviews.author: phry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The Acer Predator line of gaming monitors is something I've always wanted since they were released. I've owned a couple of bigger monitors and this is by far the best. The colors are incredible, the response time is incredible, overall a great monitor. I can only really think of 2 cons. First, the price. I got it on sale so it helped, at the time of writing this it is still on sale. The second is the resolution, 2560 x 1440. Most AAA games with good graphics, Call of Duty Modern Warfare, Apex Legends, Battlefield, etc are going to require a good video card in order to fully utilize the ability of a 144hz monitor.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: But love it being able to do school work with word ...
customer_reviews.text: Little bleed when on black screen. But love it being able to do school work with word and web browser side by side and not have it hard to read. Amazing for games Prey moon crash is my jam right now and it is fun with a screen that takes most of my view and fills it with game not my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Buck

customer_reviews.title: Bad for gaming, great for productivity while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: After a year this monitor has started displaying color bands and purple hues that will flash across the screen while I am editing photos. Gaming seems to be issue free other than the fact that this monitor is just not great for gaming. It has terrible ghosting. Even at the overclocked 120hz faster movement causes everything to sort of just smear around. Up untill I started having issues with color I would of recommended this to anyone for professional work but since mine is defective after only a year and it will not be replaced by Acer I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of colors, great image quality
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to try a wide, curved monitor due to fear of color wash out, and brightness issues but it actually looks pretty nice out of the box and only took a few easy tweaks to achieve a perfect balance of colors to my liking(which I was never able to do on previous 2 smaller gaming monitors) Image quality is actually much better than my previous Asus 27" gaming monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Fish&dive

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I figured this monitor deserved it. I went from using an Asus VG248QE 144hz 1080p monitor to this ultrawide beast. I wasn't too impressed at first but that was because my 1070 was holding me back. I popped in a RTX 2080 and this baby really came alive. It is truly a treat to game on. Easily OC to 120 with no issues, no dead pixels, no real complaints at all. G sync is incredible, everything feels amazingly smooth. I highly recommend this monitor to anyone looking for an upgrade. 5/5, very pleased and truly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: RMA'd It and it came back still broken.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for less than a year and a few weeks ago it wouldnt receive any power. I shipped it back under warranty and as I suspected it would come back still broken. What's next?
customer_reviews.author: Tripp Ivie

customer_reviews.title: Like others are saying this monitor has big quality problems
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the monitor even a year and the on screen display stopped working. I'm now unable to change any settings or even from displayport to HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Both purchases started to flicker
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these and the left side of the screen started to flicker with horizontal lines. I returned it to amazon and ordered another one thinking it was a one off thing. The second one I ordered has started doing the same thing. Luckily it started in my 30 day return window. The quality of panels in these monitors is really not great.
customer_reviews.author: William Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: It is a excellent gaming monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I have had it about a month now, and it has been awesome playing some of my favorite games at 144hz. I had a 35 inch Ultrawide as my main display so I actually dropped in size a little, but I am much happier with it. 32 is a perfect size, and the 16:9 aspect is just better right now. As more support comes for 21:9 ultrawide my opinion may change. This monitor will overclock to 165hz but seems to lose some color accuracy, but really I can't tell a huge difference between 144 & 165 Tbh. I think 1440p is the best resolution for gaming right now and for me this monitor fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Generally good, but 120hz is an overclock and causes flickering
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has a great picture and its size makes it great for gaming and productivity. One of the reasons I bought it though was because of the 120hz capabilities. The issue I found was the 120hz setting was an overclock. The default is 100hz and when overclocked it caused screen flickering after a few weeks. (I'm using a 2080 Super with up to date drivers). For almost $1,000 I expected more stable performance.
customer_reviews.author: David Fitzmaurice

customer_reviews.title: Its Great
customer_reviews.text: So far the monitor's display ports are too covered and make it difficult to connect cables. There is the batman symbol visible when the screen is completely black. I don't know if it is an indicator in the future for dead pixels. Positive side the audio is great, the screen profiles are helpful, and swivels or raises well.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan A

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Looked at a lot of different monitors and this is the one I chose. No regrets so far. Gaming, movies, and everything else this monitor looks and performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Fantasy Fan

customer_reviews.title: It came broken....
customer_reviews.text: The rear buttons that power on and alter the settings were inoperable. This means the only way to turn off the monitor is to unplug it, and changing the settings is impossible. It seems the board that holds the switches and such fell inside the back of the monitor. This was the case when I first opened the box. I have requested a refund and I'm sjipping it back this weekend. Total shame ... the monitor looks great other than this huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great 3440x1440, ips, 120hz gsync 4ms gaming monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for $700 pre black Friday sale . Awesome sweetspot res before making jump to 4k. I run this with an rtx 2080ti and 3800x, 16gb ddr4 3200 ram. It is a nice panel. My only con is the stand didn't need to be so large but if that's the only con its a worthwhile purchase provided you have the hardware to push it .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my brother in law as a thank you gift for helping my family in need. He loves it and wont let it out of his sight. Perfect for his gaming needs and more. I highly recommend this gaming monitor. What it should say on the box with all the other features is "happiness after install". Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great response time, picture, color, plus superb G-SYNC custom I/O menu
customer_reviews.text: Only thing i can say i dislike is the bright blue power LED's, which doesn't really match well with the red and black outlay, but is easily covered up with light dims. This monitor(other predators as well) comes with tons of input settings built in to tweak game-play, writing/typing, and web surfing, etc, for perfect display for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Brown

customer_reviews.title: this monitor is simply amazing. Great IPS display
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this monitor is simply amazing. Great IPS display, came with 0 dead pixels. 100Hz refresh rate out of the box is amazing and gaming is a real immersive treat with this monitor. If this is within your price range, do yourself a favor and pick one up
customer_reviews.author: Jerry McJerry

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Outside of the slight backlight bleed (which isn't really an issue for me, but I know some hate it), the monitor is outstanding. Ultrawide is amazing, and feels like a noticeable upgrade and new experience from 2k. I will probably never play on a 16:9 panel again after having put so many hours on this. Games that support 21:9? Every one that I've played on it so far. I know Blizzard games have had issues with support in the past, but I don't really play those, and I haven't found any games that run into any issues. If it's able to fit into your budget and you have higher end pc hardware, this monitor is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but screen flickers *UPDATED*
customer_reviews.text: Screen flickers constantly. Tried changing cable. Didn't work. About to request RMA... **UPDATE** Amazon replaced it in a timely fashion. Rep was polite and helpful. Works beautifully! No flickering, no dead pixels. Games look BRILLIANT. TV is ok. Stunning color and ultra-sharp. Good monitor for 2080ti.
customer_reviews.author: Ripazoid

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: It's great. I was a little worried of dead pixels, ghosting, etc. Because of other reviews; but like most products, far more people who have issues leave reviews as opposed to people with positive experiences. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: M. Popp

customer_reviews.title: Sim Racing
customer_reviews.text: No dead pixels - was worried about this. The monitor distance is only 18" from my eyes. Works well for an alternative to a 3 monitor setup. Must use the DisplayPort to get 120Hz refresh.
customer_reviews.author: MHC

customer_reviews.title: Gaming
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor i had bought the asus 165hz 27” curve but it was too bright but this one perfect and its a 32” 165hz 2k monitor i love it so far
customer_reviews.author: Beans

customer_reviews.title: Love this monitor
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t certain if I was gonna like a curved monitor but I am very happy that I purchased this. The picture quality is fantastic, there’s no light bleeding at the edges, and it’s got a mile of screen real estate. Very happy gaming on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful! Old gaming monitor went out so decided to upgrade. Was not disappointed. Attached a photo with other monitor comparisons. This monitor is a beast!
customer_reviews.author: Luba

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: This my first gaming monitor. I am supper impressed. I just hooked it up and games look unbelievable. It wasnt cheap but seems worth it. I hope it holds up. SouthBeachSteve
customer_reviews.author: D Fortune

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be calibrated.
customer_reviews.text: Its a top of the line curved screen monitor for sure. My only issue here was with the products colors. The default settings are not quite right. I had to use a spyder 5 to get the settings to my preference . Out of box will take some tweaking. Once calibration is complete your monitor is good to go and looks fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best monitor I have ever owned. Great color, great response rate. Love the resolution. and being able to OC it to 120Hz is a nice plus. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BeholdenCypress

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 32 in curved 1440p 165 hz gsync. This monitor rocks, it replaced a 60hz 29 in 4k and it's so much better. Internal speakers are decent. Would but another one in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.author: BigBoreBrappin

customer_reviews.title: System Malfunctioned after only 5 months. Support was awful
customer_reviews.text: Product is nice and picture was clean and crisp however,...... monitor started to flickedr at top after only a few months. Support wants me to pay to ship this ttian of a monitor to them to have it repaired. After only 5 months of use me having to pay for this to be repaired is just ridiculous. Do yourself a favor and look at samsung or Asus. Similar products better quality ansd support.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bronman

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected and amazing quality from Acer! Late delivery and inattentive service from amazon though...I'd source it from somewhere else if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Plisko

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor and price for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these monitors last year. That was my intro to the whole ultrawide world. Loved it. Ended up buying a bigger home and bought a second one in August of 2019. Now I'm running dual ultra wide. I'll agree with the others that say the plugs are hard to get to but it isn't a deal breaker for me. Great for the price. My brother has the 34 inch Alienware and it's nice but u get same specs and an inch bigger with this.
customer_reviews.author: Spiderdaddie

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor I went from having a 27 inch 60hz monitor to this and I am not displeased. Easily oc to 120hz and this thing is massive. I love the realitive simplistic design and the led lights on the bottom are a good touch.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I’ve owned so far
customer_reviews.text: Perfect monitor after moving from the Dell 24” S2417DG, which became too small after a while. I can barely tell a difference between the 165fps and 120 FPS. It is just the right brightness, which I had doubts before purchasing. The only problem I had was the USPS shipping, which was lost in OKC. So Amazon shipped me another on UPS. I imagine someone else is enjoying the first one that got “sidetracked”.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely changed gaming for me!
customer_reviews.text: I was initially looking for a 1440p 144hz monitor but the XB271HU was out of stock so I decided to jump on this monitor when I saw it for $749.99 and I am glad I did. I was nervous about going from two monitors back to one but the ultrawide transition was seamless. The amount of details and just extra screen I get in my games is phenomenal. Love this monitor I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor, the stand is great and looks very nice. Movement and adjustments are perfect. Picture quality is exactly how you would expect... Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and worth it...
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing all around... not a bad thing so far and love the wall mount. Have had 5 different ones and will not ever need another.... I got tired of buying "the same specs" ones for cheaper and got fed up.... this one does it all and is bight, fast for pc graphics that are up to date..... just an amazing one and get the 4k higher Hertz hdmi cables for better hdmi exp. But display pirt is the BEST....
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence s.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for a gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great looking monitor. The curved screen is a bit too much for me but the rest of the family loves it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingAussies

customer_reviews.title: Defective speakers and expensive to return
customer_reviews.text: The speakers don't work and the 120hz refresh setting causes a 1 row flicker on the very top row of pixels. Still a nice upgrade at $999. Not worth shipping back at this point. Would cost more in shipping than the features are worth to me.
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: Crispy gaming at its best
customer_reviews.text: Came from a 1080p 60hz screen to this massive 34in wide screen. Its been a great monitor since i pulled it out of the box and have had zero issues with it. Overclocking to 120hz is very easy and takes just a few clicks in the menus.
customer_reviews.author: StandardShipping

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickers every 2 sec.
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of use can use 120hz anylonger because the screen flickers every 2 seconds. Complete waste of 900$ don‘t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, Looking good!
customer_reviews.text: High quality, works great! Hope you've got more....Excellent for the PC gamer I built for a client.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robin M. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Bigger then I image but over all Iam happy thnaks .
customer_reviews.text: Well designed . looks great has a some back like bleed but not noticeable unless you have a black screen .
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dave

customer_reviews.title: Terrible cloud spots
customer_reviews.text: This was the second monitor and both exhibit very bad cloud spots very visible on black backgrounds. Sad I have to return.
customer_reviews.author: TechFreak

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a 42 inch flat LCD monitor. This one is excellent with extreme detail. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: G. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of positive and negative reviews. Have had this for a few months now and have no complaints at all. Colors are beautiful and overall impression of the monitor and stand is very positive. Would recommend if someone is looking for a monitor for gaming in this size.
customer_reviews.author: monica koski

customer_reviews.title: Well built and performing monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great screen clarity and performance. The monitor is very heavy, but makes it incredibly stable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyFirst

customer_reviews.title: its a really nice monitor the best I've own but the only thing ...
customer_reviews.text: its a really nice monitor the best I've own but the only thing I dont like and many other moniters have this is the backlight bleed if you are paying it's not that noticeable you cab only notice it when the corners are black for a long time like when you watch a movie.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I like this monitor. It has everything I need in terms of specs. Just 2 things to keep in mind. 1. Monitor is a bit thick and 2. Not many connection ports.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: First one had the flickering issue, was replaced and new one is great.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got had the flickering issue others have brought up. I got a replacement and love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Asus had their grimy hands all over this product
customer_reviews.text: The product was defective out of the box, which is odd for Acer products. I did some research and found out that Asus had helped with the development of this product. Explains the defects. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Socko Monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of jacks in the back of this monitor. Easy set-up. Nice footprint.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Kaiser Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this display. The only issue I had was with flickering. Once I disabled over clocking, it ran like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Does not support 1440p 120hz for Xbox update
customer_reviews.text: I can tell it’s a great monitor but I returned it because I am playing on a Xbox one x and it wouldn’t allow 1440p 120hz just 60hz. I ordered the Samsung C32HG70 instead. If anybody knows a way for me to meet those settings on the Xbox wit the predator please inform me because I honestly didn’t Wana return it. It was so big n pretty but just didn’t fulfill my need
customer_reviews.author: DEWAYNE JONEZ

customer_reviews.title: Was it overkill?
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful display. Mine had very little backlight bleed and no dead pixels that I couod find. Only downside is not as many games as i would like support this aspect ratio. Yes it was overkill, but hey I can spoil myself every now and again.
customer_reviews.author: It's a me, Mario.

customer_reviews.title: Backlight pattern ruins an otherwise lovely display.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is big. Looks cool. Resolution and ghz are solid. What kills it is an extremely inconsistent backlight. If you’re gaming this isn’t noticeable. But as soon as you bring up a website, all you can see in the solid white background is the backlight pattern. Maybe this wouldn’t bother some people but I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: David Eagle

customer_reviews.title: We’ll build an amazing screen worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gaming monitor if your looking for High FPS monitor an well build this acre predator z35P is yours! The only thing u might want to take in mind is this screen is BIG !
customer_reviews.author: Izec Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Great all around ultrawide
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality, feels smoother and better than my original 1080p curved display and the built in audio is about the same quality as a TV which is what I was kinda using this as. The pass through audio jack is distorted and thus ruined my audio set up from my last monitor.
customer_reviews.author: jacob alexander

customer_reviews.title: Best Monitor I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: After using this monitor for a couple weeks now, I will never use anything that is not an ultra wide again. It is visually stunning and I love the customization that it offers in the simple to navigate control panel at the bottom. Running everything in Ultra settings with this monitor is just flat out stunning. It is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for. I Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is amazing, I have nothing but positive things to say about it. I wish it was 4K, but its fine
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Acer are gods
customer_reviews.text: Not only one of the more noticeable improvements to your build but also makes taking in game screenshots to the next level. They are gorgeous landscape shots with zero editing. And my screen thank the gods came with no light bleed on the corners
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Acer makes another great monitor with G-Sync
customer_reviews.text: Acer I'm impresses again with HD edge to edge picture with awesome quality. If your game is built for a 21:9 ration (Like Rage 2) prepare to be blown away
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Audio Issues
customer_reviews.text: Washed out colors. I purchased two of the z35p's and both appear washed out and have audio issues. I really regret buying this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor until high refresh HDR GSYNC comes out.
customer_reviews.text: Very feature rich for only$600 VA panel 1440p 165hz G sync Curved Just wish that it was HDR... But there are also no HDR pannels with all of the features above yet.
customer_reviews.author: Neltin H.

customer_reviews.title: THIS MONITOR IS STUNNING
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is just what I wanted! A large, high resolution, fast hertz monitor all in one package. Adjustable height stand, several on board options, and a wonderful picture. I will never go back to 16:9 ratio anytime soon or ever!
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Poor Acer shipping but nice product
customer_reviews.text: Amazon helped me a bunch when it came to the shipping of this item and the overall product is nice. 4 stars because of Acer's slow attempt at shipping
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Best Bang for the Buck does what it says it does
customer_reviews.author: TED

product_meta.title: Acer Predator Z35P bmiphz 35" Curved 1800R QHD (3440x1440) NVIDIA G-SYNC VA Monitor
product_meta.description: Style:Curved (1800R) QHD (3440x1440) VA G-SYNC| Size:35-InchGet the edge on your opponents with a massive 35" Ultra Wide curved display with a lightning-fast refresh rate and NVIDIA G-SYNC. The Predator Z35P curved screen transforms your viewing experience drawing you deep into the action while NVIDIA G-SYNC technology eliminates screen tearing for an epic gaming experience. Combined with Acer TrueHarmony and a great design, this monitor is worthy of the most advanced gaming setups. The brightness is 300 nit
feature_bullets: 35" QHD Curved 1800R UltraWide Screen with 3440 x 1440 resolution
Response Time: 4ms, Pixel Pitch: 0.34mm, 2 x 9W speakers
Ultra Low Motion Blur only works at 100Hz, 120Hz and 144Hz
Signal inputs: 1 x HDMI (V1.4), 1 x Display port (V1.2) & USB 3.0

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars494 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
